summary: Discussion focused on Conga transaction utilization issues and account structure for individual vs business customers. The team discussed an urgent notice about over-utilization of Conga Composer transactions and potential cost implications of $4,000. They also explored how to handle customer accounts when individuals later form business entities.
key_topics: Account structure for individual vs business customers
Sole proprietor vs legal entity distinctions
decisions: Communication with Laura should go to Faye email, not Maxim email
Individual accounts should not be renamed when customer forms a business - new opportunities should be created instead

action_items.task: Schedule meeting with Conga representative to discuss utilization

concerns: Over-utilization of Conga transactions leading to additional costs
Lack of visibility into how Conga is being used across teams
Potential inefficient use of software licenses
michael_priorities: Understanding and controlling Conga license costs
Having strategic approach to software spending
Avoiding incremental cost discussions without full contract understanding

commitments.commitment: Will investigate Conga usage and come back with either reduction strategies or confirmation that additional payment is needed
